channel.title: gitattributes on Thomas Levesque's .NET Blog
channel.description: Recent content in gitattributes on Thomas Levesque's .NET Blog

item.title: C# methods in git diff hunk headers
item.description: If you use git on the command line, you may have noticed that diff hunks often show the method signature in the hunk header (the line that starts with @@), like this: diff --git a/Program.cs b/Program.cs index 655a213..5ae1016 100644 --- a/Program.cs +++ b/Program.cs @@ -13,6 +13,7 @@ static void Main(string[] args) Console.WriteLine("Hello World!"); Console.WriteLine("Hello World!"); Console.WriteLine("Hello World!"); + Console.WriteLine("blah"); } This is very useful to know where you are when looking at a diff.
